form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Markey introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship

form.official-title: To expand the surety bond program under the Small Business Investment Act of 1958, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expanding the Surety Bond Program Act of 2025.

section.header: Expansion of the Surety Bond Program

subsection.text: Part B of title IV of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 694a et seq.) is amended—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking $6,500,000 and inserting $20,000,000; and
by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: The Administrator may guarantee a surety under subparagraph (A) for a total work order or contract in an amount that does not exceed $20,000,000.

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking the comma at the end and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (2), by striking $6,500,000, and inserting the amount described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of subsection (a)(1), as applicable;; and
in paragraph (3), by striking , or and inserting ; or; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), in the third sentence, by striking , excluding administrative expenses,;
by redesignating subsection (b) as subsection (c); and
by inserting after subsection (a) the following:

subsection.text: Not more than 5 percent of the amount in the fund described in subsection (a) on the first day of each fiscal year may be obligated during that fiscal year to cover costs incurred by the Administration in connection with the management and administration of this part, including costs related to information technology and systems, personnel, outreach activities, and relevant contracts.
